alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 6:54PM EDT until July 05 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR ALAMANCE...NORTHERN RANDOLPH AND GUILFORD COUNTIES... At 653 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Thomasville to near Kernersville to near McLeansville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Greensboro Airport reported a wind gust of 64 mph! IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, High Point, Burlington, Graham, Randleman, Mebane, Elon, McLeansville, Archdale and Trinity. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
